alert.note: Alert for Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 16 at 6:06AM EDT by NWS Key West
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Ocean Reef in Upper Keys * WHEN...Until 700 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 605 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ocean Reef and North Key Largo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely.
